pageContext.claim: “I think I'm doing great with the African-American vote, because we have the best unemployment numbers.”
pageContext.analysis: Reputable polls consistently find that Trump has very low support among African Americans -- and that it has declined since the 2016 election. For example, Quinnipiac in August found that 9 percent of black voters approved, compared with 85 percent who disapproved. Trump seemingly was referring to a single, poorly rated poll that is often an outlier giving him higher numbers (Rasmussen).
